summary:
• The article discusses the challenges faced by women in Afghanistan, particularly during the country's beauty pageants.
• Despite being considered one of the worst places to be a woman, the beauty pageants serve as an outlet for self-expression and empowerment.
• In contrast, the Taliban is attempting to reconcile science and religion in addressing climate change, highlighting their efforts towards sustainability and environmental awareness.

• The Copa America tournament was marred by controversy due to security issues.
• The incident nearly turned deadly, sparking widespread concern among spectators.
• As a result, the event was rebranded as the "party that almost became a tragedy".

• Asia's richest man hosts lavish star-studded wedding
• Event features spectacular decorations and performances
• Critics label it as "vulgar" due to excess and extravagance

• The Olympic flame arrived in Paris.
• It was placed at the center of the Bastille Day parade.
• This event is part of the celebration for Bastille Day.

• The Gambian government has maintained its ban on Female Genital Cutting (FGC), which involves the partial or total removal of external female genitalia.
• This decision comes amid concerns that the ban may be lifted, allowing FGC to resume in the country.
• In contrast, some girls have already undergone the procedure despite their parents' efforts to protect them from FGC.

• The German government has implemented a policy requiring certain asylum seekers to participate in labor programs as part of their integration process.
• This decision aims to provide these individuals with job training, skills development, and social adaptation to better prepare them for employment upon obtaining refugee status.
• Critics argue that this approach may be overly restrictive and undermine the dignity of refugees who simply wish to pursue legitimate employment opportunities.

• A previously unknown "sky island" rainforest in Indonesia has been preserved due to recent discoveries.
• The isolated ecosystem is home to unique species that thrive in its high-altitude environment.
• Scientists hope to learn from this natural wonder and apply their findings to protect other vulnerable ecosystems globally.

• Violence breaks out in Dublin over planned asylum seeker housing.
• Prime Minister condemns violence as "reprehensible".
• Stars remember musician Shane Doherty who passed away suddenly.

• Israel's military is concerned about potential conflict with Lebanon.
• Israeli airstrikes have killed 90 people in Gaza, including a high-ranking Hamas official.
• The death toll in Gaza continues to rise as Israel and Hamas negotiate a ceasefire agreement.

• Dozens of Indian workers were rescued from "slave-like" conditions in Italy.
• An Italian court sentenced an Instagram influencer to prison for human trafficking and exploitation.

• Serial killer caught after bodies found in Kenya dump.
• Professors struggling to teach Munro after abuse revelations.
• President fires hated ministers amid weeks of protests.

• The popular US-based grocery store chain Trader Joe's has launched a new line of seasonings in South Korea.
• However, these products have sparked controversy as they contain MSG, which is banned by Korean law due to concerns over its potential health effects.
• As a result, the products can no longer be legally sold or distributed in the country.

• Fans celebrate after Spain's royal welcome in Madrid
• Royal family arrives at Adolfo Suárez Madrid–Barajas Airport
• Thousands gather to greet Spanish monarchs

• Many Syrians are fleeing their country due to ongoing conflict.
• Some have joined African mercenaries to escape instability at home.
• This trend is becoming increasingly common among displaced Syrian individuals.

• Princess Catherine returns to public life after announcing her cancer diagnosis.
• She will present the trophy to the men's Wimbledon champion.
• The event showcases the royal family's continued support for tennis in the UK.

• President Trump may make his first public appearance since an assassination attempt.
• JD Vance has been criticized for supporting Trump in the past but now serves as his running mate.
• Former Vice President Joe Biden defended his statement that Trump poses a danger to democracy during a recent event.

• Free education policy implemented in Zambia
• Overcrowding issues arise due to increased enrollment
• Strain on resources and infrastructure persists
